description: Landing page loads successfully with all core sections visible
steps: Step 1: Navigate to / (landing page)
Step 2: Verify page loads without errors
Step 3: Verify hero section is visible
Step 4: Verify features section is visible
Step 5: Verify CTA buttons are present

description: Landing page has proper responsive design on mobile devices
steps: Step 1: Navigate to landing page
Step 2: Set viewport to mobile size (375px width)
Step 3: Take screenshot
Step 4: Verify navigation is mobile-friendly
Step 5: Verify content is readable and properly sized

description: GitHub OAuth login flow initiates correctly
steps: Step 1: Navigate to landing page
Step 2: Click 'Sign in with GitHub' button
Step 3: Verify redirect to GitHub OAuth page
Step 4: Verify correct OAuth scopes are requested (repo, user:email)

description: Complete GitHub OAuth authentication flow
steps: Step 1: Navigate to landing page
Step 2: Click 'Sign in with GitHub' button
Step 3: Authorize application on GitHub
Step 4: Verify redirect back to application
Step 5: Verify user is authenticated
Step 6: Verify redirect to dashboard
Step 7: Verify user session is created

description: Dashboard displays after successful authentication
steps: Step 1: Complete GitHub OAuth login
Step 2: Navigate to /dashboard
Step 3: Verify dashboard page loads
Step 4: Verify user profile information is displayed
Step 5: Verify repository list section is present

description: Dashboard fetches user's GitHub repositories
steps: Step 1: Login and navigate to dashboard
Step 2: Wait for repositories to load
Step 3: Verify API call to /api/repos is made
Step 4: Verify repository list is displayed
Step 5: Verify each repository shows name and description
Step 6: Verify loading state is shown while fetching

description: User can add a repository for documentation
steps: Step 1: Login and navigate to dashboard
Step 2: Click 'Add Repository' button
Step 3: Select a repository from the list
Step 4: Click 'Add' button
Step 5: Verify POST request to /api/repos
Step 6: Verify repository appears in tracked list
Step 7: Verify success notification is shown

description: Repository analysis is triggered after adding repository
steps: Step 1: Add a new repository
Step 2: Verify POST request to /api/repos/:id/analyze
Step 3: Verify analysis status shows 'analyzing'
Step 4: Verify progress indicator is displayed
Step 5: Wait for analysis to complete
Step 6: Verify status changes to 'completed'
Step 7: Verify notification of completion

description: Code analysis engine parses JavaScript files correctly
steps: Step 1: Add repository with JavaScript files
Step 2: Trigger code analysis
Step 3: Verify Tree-sitter parser is invoked
Step 4: Verify functions are extracted
Step 5: Verify classes are extracted
Step 6: Verify imports/exports are identified
Step 7: Verify AST is generated
Step 8: Verify analysis results are stored in database

description: Code analysis engine parses TypeScript files correctly
steps: Step 1: Add repository with TypeScript files
Step 2: Trigger code analysis
Step 3: Verify TypeScript parser is used
Step 4: Verify interfaces are extracted
Step 5: Verify type definitions are captured
Step 6: Verify generic types are handled
Step 7: Verify analysis results are stored

description: Code analysis engine parses Python files correctly
steps: Step 1: Add repository with Python files
Step 2: Trigger code analysis
Step 3: Verify Python parser is used
Step 4: Verify functions and classes are extracted
Step 5: Verify decorators are captured
Step 6: Verify docstrings are extracted
Step 7: Verify analysis results are stored

description: AI generates README documentation using Claude API
steps: Step 1: Complete code analysis for a repository
Step 2: Trigger README generation
Step 3: Verify Claude API is called with code context
Step 4: Verify README content is generated
Step 5: Verify README includes project overview
Step 6: Verify README includes setup instructions
Step 7: Verify README includes usage examples
Step 8: Verify README is saved to database
Step 9: Verify README is displayed in documentation viewer

description: AI generates API documentation for endpoints
steps: Step 1: Analyze repository with API endpoints
Step 2: Trigger API documentation generation
Step 3: Verify Claude API is called with endpoint details
Step 4: Verify API docs include endpoint descriptions
Step 5: Verify request/response schemas are documented
Step 6: Verify authentication requirements are noted
Step 7: Verify example requests are generated
Step 8: Verify API docs are saved and displayed

description: AI generates function-level documentation
steps: Step 1: Analyze repository with functions
Step 2: Trigger function documentation generation
Step 3: Verify each function is documented
Step 4: Verify parameter descriptions are included
Step 5: Verify return value documentation is present
Step 6: Verify usage examples are provided
Step 7: Verify function docs are linked to source code

description: AI generates class-level documentation
steps: Step 1: Analyze repository with classes
Step 2: Trigger class documentation generation
Step 3: Verify class purpose is documented
Step 4: Verify constructor parameters are documented
Step 5: Verify methods are documented
Step 6: Verify properties are documented
Step 7: Verify usage examples are provided

description: AI generates architecture diagrams in Mermaid format
steps: Step 1: Complete repository analysis
Step 2: Trigger architecture diagram generation
Step 3: Verify Claude API generates Mermaid syntax
Step 4: Verify diagram shows module relationships
Step 5: Verify diagram shows data flow
Step 6: Verify Mermaid code is valid and renderable
Step 7: Verify diagram is saved with documentation

description: Documentation viewer displays generated README
steps: Step 1: Login and navigate to dashboard
Step 2: Click on a documented repository
Step 3: Navigate to /repos/[id]
Step 4: Verify README documentation is displayed
Step 5: Verify markdown is properly rendered
Step 6: Verify heading hierarchy is preserved

description: Documentation viewer has table of contents navigation
steps: Step 1: Navigate to documentation viewer
Step 2: Verify table of contents is visible
Step 3: Verify TOC lists all major sections
Step 4: Click on a TOC item
Step 5: Verify page scrolls to correct section
Step 6: Verify active section is highlighted in TOC

description: Documentation viewer has syntax highlighting for code blocks
steps: Step 1: Navigate to documentation with code examples
Step 2: Locate code block in documentation
Step 3: Verify syntax highlighting is applied
Step 4: Verify language-specific highlighting (JS, Python, etc.)
Step 5: Verify inline code is styled differently

description: Code blocks have copy-to-clipboard functionality
steps: Step 1: Navigate to documentation with code blocks
Step 2: Hover over a code block
Step 3: Verify copy button appears
Step 4: Click copy button
Step 5: Verify success feedback is shown
Step 6: Verify code is copied to clipboard

description: Documentation viewer has working search functionality
steps: Step 1: Navigate to documentation viewer
Step 2: Locate search input field
Step 3: Type search query
Step 4: Verify search results appear in real-time
Step 5: Verify results are highlighted in content
Step 6: Click on a search result
Step 7: Verify navigation to relevant section

description: Search returns results in under 200ms
steps: Step 1: Navigate to documentation viewer
Step 2: Enter search query
Step 3: Measure time to display results
Step 4: Verify response time is under 200ms
Step 5: Test with multiple search queries
Step 6: Verify all searches meet performance requirement

description: Dark mode toggle works across all pages
steps: Step 1: Navigate to any page
Step 2: Locate dark mode toggle button
Step 3: Click toggle to enable dark mode
Step 4: Verify all UI elements switch to dark theme
Step 5: Navigate to different page
Step 6: Verify dark mode persists
Step 7: Toggle back to light mode and verify

description: Dark mode has proper contrast and readability
steps: Step 1: Enable dark mode
Step 2: Navigate through all pages
Step 3: Take screenshots of each page
Step 4: Verify text is readable on dark background
Step 5: Verify code blocks have appropriate colors
Step 6: Verify buttons and interactive elements are visible

description: AI chat interface is accessible from repository page
steps: Step 1: Navigate to documented repository
Step 2: Locate 'Chat' button or link
Step 3: Click to navigate to /repos/[id]/chat
Step 4: Verify chat interface loads
Step 5: Verify chat input field is present
Step 6: Verify chat history area is present

description: User can send a message in AI chat
steps: Step 1: Navigate to chat interface
Step 2: Type a question in chat input
Step 3: Click send button or press Enter
Step 4: Verify message appears in chat history
Step 5: Verify POST request to /api/repos/:id/chat
Step 6: Verify loading indicator is shown
Step 7: Verify AI response appears
Step 8: Verify response is relevant to question

description: AI chat uses RAG to provide context-aware responses
steps: Step 1: Navigate to chat interface
Step 2: Ask specific question about codebase function
Step 3: Submit question
Step 4: Verify vector search is performed on embeddings
Step 5: Verify relevant code chunks are retrieved
Step 6: Verify Claude API is called with context
Step 7: Verify response references specific code
Step 8: Verify response accuracy against actual code

description: AI chat response time is under 3 seconds
steps: Step 1: Navigate to chat interface
Step 2: Send a question
Step 3: Start timer when message is sent
Step 4: Stop timer when response starts appearing
Step 5: Verify response time is under 3 seconds
Step 6: Test with multiple questions
Step 7: Verify all responses meet performance requirement

description: Vector embeddings are generated for code chunks
steps: Step 1: Complete code analysis for repository
Step 2: Verify code is chunked appropriately
Step 3: Verify chunks are sent to embedding API
Step 4: Verify embeddings are generated
Step 5: Verify embeddings are stored in Pinecone
Step 6: Verify metadata is attached to each embedding
Step 7: Query embeddings to verify they're searchable

description: GitHub webhook is set up when repository is added
steps: Step 1: Add a new repository
Step 2: Verify API call to GitHub to create webhook
Step 3: Verify webhook URL points to /api/webhooks/github
Step 4: Verify webhook is configured for push events
Step 5: Verify webhook secret is set
Step 6: Verify webhook creation success is logged

description: GitHub webhook receives push events
steps: Step 1: Set up webhook for repository
Step 2: Make a push to the repository
Step 3: Verify POST request to /api/webhooks/github
Step 4: Verify webhook signature is validated
Step 5: Verify push event payload is parsed
Step 6: Verify changed files are identified
Step 7: Verify webhook processing is logged

description: Auto-update system re-analyzes changed files after push
steps: Step 1: Set up repository with webhook
Step 2: Push changes to specific files
Step 3: Verify webhook triggers analysis
Step 4: Verify only changed files are re-analyzed
Step 5: Verify new analysis results are generated
Step 6: Verify documentation is regenerated for affected files
Step 7: Verify embeddings are updated
Step 8: Verify user is notified of update
Step 9: Verify last_sync timestamp is updated

description: Auto-update completes in under 5 minutes for small repositories
steps: Step 1: Use repository with less than 10K lines
Step 2: Push change to trigger auto-update
Step 3: Start timer when webhook is received
Step 4: Monitor update progress
Step 5: Stop timer when update completes
Step 6: Verify total time is under 5 minutes
Step 7: Verify documentation is updated

description: Update history shows all documentation updates
steps: Step 1: Navigate to repository settings
Step 2: Locate update history section
Step 3: Verify list of all updates is shown
Step 4: Verify each entry shows timestamp
Step 5: Verify each entry shows trigger (manual/webhook)
Step 6: Verify each entry shows status
Step 7: Verify entries are sorted by date (newest first)

description: Repository settings page is accessible
steps: Step 1: Navigate to documented repository
Step 2: Click on 'Settings' button
Step 3: Navigate to /repos/[id]/settings
Step 4: Verify settings page loads
Step 5: Verify repository information is displayed

description: User can manually trigger documentation regeneration
steps: Step 1: Navigate to repository settings
Step 2: Locate 'Regenerate Documentation' button
Step 3: Click the button
Step 4: Verify confirmation dialog appears
Step 5: Confirm regeneration
Step 6: Verify POST to /api/repos/:id/analyze
Step 7: Verify progress indicator is shown
Step 8: Wait for completion
Step 9: Verify success notification

description: User can remove a repository
steps: Step 1: Navigate to repository settings
Step 2: Locate 'Remove Repository' button
Step 3: Click remove button
Step 4: Verify warning dialog appears
Step 5: Confirm removal
Step 6: Verify DELETE request to /api/repos/:id
Step 7: Verify redirect to dashboard
Step 8: Verify repository no longer appears in list

description: User settings page displays user profile
steps: Step 1: Login to application
Step 2: Navigate to /settings
Step 3: Verify settings page loads
Step 4: Verify user avatar is displayed
Step 5: Verify user name is displayed
Step 6: Verify user email is displayed
Step 7: Verify GitHub username is displayed

description: User can logout from settings page
steps: Step 1: Navigate to user settings
Step 2: Locate 'Logout' button
Step 3: Click logout button
Step 4: Verify session is cleared
Step 5: Verify redirect to landing page
Step 6: Verify user is no longer authenticated
Step 7: Verify attempting to access dashboard redirects to login

description: Database stores user information correctly
steps: Step 1: Complete GitHub OAuth flow
Step 2: Query users table in PostgreSQL
Step 3: Verify user record exists
Step 4: Verify github_id is stored
Step 5: Verify email is stored
Step 6: Verify name is stored
Step 7: Verify avatar_url is stored
Step 8: Verify created_at timestamp is set

description: Database stores repository information correctly
steps: Step 1: Add a repository
Step 2: Query repositories table
Step 3: Verify repository record exists
Step 4: Verify user_id foreign key is correct
Step 5: Verify github_repo_id is stored
Step 6: Verify name and url are stored
Step 7: Verify last_sync timestamp is set
Step 8: Verify status field is set

description: Database stores generated documents correctly
steps: Step 1: Generate documentation for repository
Step 2: Query documents table
Step 3: Verify document records exist
Step 4: Verify repo_id foreign key is correct
Step 5: Verify path field identifies document type
Step 6: Verify content is stored
Step 7: Verify type field categorizes document
Step 8: Verify generated_at timestamp is set

description: API endpoint POST /api/auth/github handles OAuth
steps: Step 1: Send POST request to /api/auth/github with OAuth code
Step 2: Verify endpoint exchanges code for access token
Step 3: Verify user info is fetched from GitHub
Step 4: Verify user is created or updated in database
Step 5: Verify session token is generated
Step 6: Verify response includes session token
Step 7: Verify proper error handling for invalid codes

description: API endpoint GET /api/repos returns user's repositories
steps: Step 1: Authenticate user
Step 2: Send GET request to /api/repos
Step 3: Verify authentication is required
Step 4: Verify repositories from database are returned
Step 5: Verify only user's own repositories are included
Step 6: Verify response includes all repository fields
Step 7: Verify response is properly formatted JSON

description: API endpoint POST /api/repos adds new repository
steps: Step 1: Authenticate user
Step 2: Send POST request with repository data
Step 3: Verify authentication is required
Step 4: Verify repository is added to database
Step 5: Verify webhook setup is triggered
Step 6: Verify analysis is queued
Step 7: Verify response includes new repository ID
Step 8: Verify proper validation of input data

description: API endpoint GET /api/repos/:id returns repository details
steps: Step 1: Add a repository
Step 2: Send GET request to /api/repos/:id
Step 3: Verify authentication is required
Step 4: Verify user owns the repository
Step 5: Verify repository details are returned
Step 6: Verify documents are included in response
Step 7: Verify 404 error for non-existent repository
Step 8: Verify 403 error for unauthorized access

description: API endpoint POST /api/repos/:id/analyze triggers analysis
steps: Step 1: Authenticate and add repository
Step 2: Send POST request to /api/repos/:id/analyze
Step 3: Verify authentication is required
Step 4: Verify user owns the repository
Step 5: Verify analysis job is queued
Step 6: Verify repository status is updated to 'analyzing'
Step 7: Verify response includes job ID or status
Step 8: Verify proper error handling

description: API endpoint GET /api/repos/:id/docs returns documentation
steps: Step 1: Generate documentation for repository
Step 2: Send GET request to /api/repos/:id/docs
Step 3: Verify authentication is required
Step 4: Verify user owns the repository
Step 5: Verify all documents are returned
Step 6: Verify documents are properly formatted
Step 7: Verify optional filtering by document type works
Step 8: Verify proper error handling

description: API endpoint POST /api/repos/:id/chat processes chat messages
steps: Step 1: Authenticate with documented repository
Step 2: Send POST request with chat message
Step 3: Verify authentication is required
Step 4: Verify user owns the repository
Step 5: Verify message is processed
Step 6: Verify RAG retrieval is performed
Step 7: Verify Claude API is called
Step 8: Verify response is returned
Step 9: Verify chat history is stored

description: API endpoint POST /api/webhooks/github validates webhook signatures
steps: Step 1: Send POST request to webhook endpoint
Step 2: Include GitHub webhook signature in headers
Step 3: Verify signature is validated using webhook secret
Step 4: Verify request with valid signature is processed
Step 5: Send request with invalid signature
Step 6: Verify request is rejected with 401 status
Step 7: Verify error is logged for invalid signatures

description: Protected routes redirect unauthenticated users
steps: Step 1: Ensure user is not authenticated
Step 2: Attempt to navigate to /dashboard
Step 3: Verify redirect to landing page or login
Step 4: Attempt to navigate to /repos/[id]
Step 5: Verify redirect to landing page or login
Step 6: Attempt to access API endpoints without auth
Step 7: Verify 401 Unauthorized responses

description: Session persistence allows user to stay logged in
steps: Step 1: Login to application
Step 2: Navigate away from application
Step 3: Close and reopen browser (if cookies persist)
Step 4: Navigate back to application
Step 5: Verify user is still authenticated
Step 6: Verify access to protected routes works
Step 7: Verify session eventually expires after timeout

description: Error handling displays user-friendly messages
steps: Step 1: Trigger various error conditions
Step 2: Verify error messages are displayed
Step 3: Verify messages are user-friendly (not technical stack traces)
Step 4: Verify appropriate error for network failures
Step 5: Verify appropriate error for validation failures
Step 6: Verify appropriate error for authentication failures

description: Loading states are displayed during async operations
steps: Step 1: Trigger async operation (e.g., fetch repositories)
Step 2: Verify loading indicator appears immediately
Step 3: Verify content is not shown while loading
Step 4: Wait for operation to complete
Step 5: Verify loading indicator disappears
Step 6: Verify content is displayed
Step 7: Test with multiple async operations

description: UI follows consistent design system using shadcn/ui components
steps: Step 1: Navigate through all pages
Step 2: Take screenshots of each page
Step 3: Verify consistent button styles
Step 4: Verify consistent input field styles
Step 5: Verify consistent card/container styles
Step 6: Verify consistent typography
Step 7: Verify consistent spacing and layout

description: Responsive design works on tablet devices
steps: Step 1: Set viewport to tablet size (768px width)
Step 2: Navigate through all pages
Step 3: Take screenshots
Step 4: Verify layout adapts appropriately
Step 5: Verify all interactive elements are accessible
Step 6: Verify text is readable
Step 7: Verify navigation works on tablet size

description: Responsive design works on desktop devices
steps: Step 1: Set viewport to desktop size (1920px width)
Step 2: Navigate through all pages
Step 3: Take screenshots
Step 4: Verify layout uses available space effectively
Step 5: Verify content is not stretched awkwardly
Step 6: Verify sidebar navigation works
Step 7: Verify multi-column layouts where appropriate

description: Color scheme follows Tailwind CSS design tokens
steps: Step 1: Inspect application styles
Step 2: Verify primary colors use Tailwind classes
Step 3: Verify semantic colors (success, error, warning)
Step 4: Verify neutral colors for backgrounds
Step 5: Verify accent colors are consistent
Step 6: Take screenshots for visual verification

description: Typography is readable and hierarchical
steps: Step 1: Navigate through application
Step 2: Verify heading sizes create clear hierarchy (h1 > h2 > h3)
Step 3: Verify body text is readable size (16px minimum)
Step 4: Verify line height is appropriate (1.5-1.7)
Step 5: Verify font weights distinguish emphasis
Step 6: Take screenshots for verification

description: Interactive elements have proper hover states
steps: Step 1: Navigate to pages with buttons
Step 2: Hover over buttons
Step 3: Verify visual feedback on hover
Step 4: Hover over links
Step 5: Verify link hover states
Step 6: Test other interactive elements (cards, etc.)
Step 7: Take screenshots of hover states

description: Focus states are visible for keyboard navigation
steps: Step 1: Navigate application using Tab key
Step 2: Verify focus ring is visible on buttons
Step 3: Verify focus ring is visible on inputs
Step 4: Verify focus ring is visible on links
Step 5: Verify focus order is logical
Step 6: Verify focus states meet accessibility standards

description: Application handles large repositories (100K lines)
steps: Step 1: Add repository with approximately 100K lines
Step 2: Trigger analysis
Step 3: Monitor memory usage
Step 4: Monitor CPU usage
Step 5: Verify analysis completes without errors
Step 6: Verify documentation is generated
Step 7: Verify search and chat still work
Step 8: Verify performance is acceptable
Step 9: Verify no memory leaks

description: Concurrent users can use the system simultaneously
steps: Step 1: Simulate multiple users logging in
Step 2: Each user adds a repository
Step 3: Trigger analysis for all repositories
Step 4: Verify all analyses run without interference
Step 5: Verify each user sees only their own repos
Step 6: Verify no data leakage between users
Step 7: Verify system remains responsive

description: Rate limiting prevents API abuse
steps: Step 1: Make rapid successive API requests
Step 2: Verify rate limit threshold
Step 3: Verify 429 Too Many Requests response
Step 4: Verify retry-after header is provided
Step 5: Wait for rate limit reset
Step 6: Verify requests work again
Step 7: Verify rate limits are per-user

description: Claude API errors are handled gracefully
steps: Step 1: Trigger documentation generation
Step 2: Simulate Claude API failure
Step 3: Verify error is caught
Step 4: Verify user is notified
Step 5: Verify partial results are saved if available
Step 6: Verify retry mechanism is triggered
Step 7: Verify maximum retry attempts are respected

description: GitHub API errors are handled gracefully
steps: Step 1: Attempt to fetch repositories
Step 2: Simulate GitHub API failure
Step 3: Verify error is caught
Step 4: Verify user-friendly error message
Step 5: Verify retry mechanism
Step 6: Verify fallback behavior if appropriate
Step 7: Verify errors are logged

description: Database connection errors are handled
steps: Step 1: Trigger database operation
Step 2: Simulate database connection failure
Step 3: Verify error is caught
Step 4: Verify service degrades gracefully
Step 5: Verify connection retry logic
Step 6: Verify user is informed of temporary issue
Step 7: Verify critical errors are logged and alerted

description: Pinecone vector database stores embeddings correctly
steps: Step 1: Generate embeddings for code chunks
Step 2: Insert embeddings into Pinecone
Step 3: Verify upsert operation succeeds
Step 4: Query Pinecone for specific embedding
Step 5: Verify embedding is retrievable
Step 6: Verify metadata is attached correctly
Step 7: Verify vector dimension is correct
Step 8: Verify namespace is used appropriately

description: Vector similarity search returns relevant results
steps: Step 1: Store multiple code chunk embeddings
Step 2: Generate query embedding for search term
Step 3: Perform similarity search in Pinecone
Step 4: Verify top-k results are returned
Step 5: Verify results are ranked by similarity score
Step 6: Verify returned chunks are actually relevant
Step 7: Test with various query types

description: Documentation supports multiple programming languages
steps: Step 1: Add repository with multiple languages (JS, Python, Go, etc.)
Step 2: Trigger documentation generation
Step 3: Verify each language is detected
Step 4: Verify appropriate parser is used for each
Step 5: Verify documentation is generated for all languages
Step 6: Verify language-specific features are handled
Step 7: Verify cross-language references work

description: MDX rendering works for documentation content
steps: Step 1: Create documentation with MDX features
Step 2: Navigate to documentation viewer
Step 3: Verify standard Markdown renders correctly
Step 4: Verify MDX components render if used
Step 5: Verify JSX in MDX works
Step 6: Verify imports in MDX work
Step 7: Verify frontmatter is parsed

description: Mermaid diagrams render correctly in documentation
steps: Step 1: Generate documentation with Mermaid diagrams
Step 2: Navigate to documentation viewer
Step 3: Locate Mermaid diagram in content
Step 4: Verify Mermaid syntax is rendered as diagram
Step 5: Verify diagram is interactive (if applicable)
Step 6: Verify diagram is responsive
Step 7: Verify multiple diagrams on same page work

description: Documentation versioning tracks changes over time
steps: Step 1: Generate initial documentation
Step 2: Note version or timestamp
Step 3: Update repository code
Step 4: Trigger documentation regeneration
Step 5: Verify new version is created
Step 6: Verify ability to view previous versions
Step 7: Verify diff between versions
Step 8: Verify version history is maintained

description: Code analysis identifies module dependencies
steps: Step 1: Analyze repository with import/export statements
Step 2: Verify imports are identified
Step 3: Verify exports are identified
Step 4: Verify dependency graph is built
Step 5: Verify circular dependencies are detected
Step 6: Verify external dependencies are distinguished from internal
Step 7: Verify dependency information is stored

description: Code analysis extracts function parameters and return types
steps: Step 1: Analyze functions with typed parameters
Step 2: Verify parameter names are extracted
Step 3: Verify parameter types are extracted
Step 4: Verify return types are extracted
Step 5: Verify default parameter values are captured
Step 6: Verify rest parameters are handled
Step 7: Verify information is used in documentation

description: Code analysis extracts inline comments
steps: Step 1: Analyze code with various comment types
Step 2: Verify single-line comments are extracted
Step 3: Verify multi-line comments are extracted
Step 4: Verify JSDoc/docstring comments are extracted
Step 5: Verify comments are associated with correct code elements
Step 6: Verify extracted comments are used in documentation

description: AI maintains consistent documentation style
steps: Step 1: Generate documentation for multiple files
Step 2: Review generated content
Step 3: Verify consistent tone across all docs
Step 4: Verify consistent structure and sections
Step 5: Verify consistent terminology
Step 6: Verify consistent formatting
Step 7: Verify style guidelines are followed

description: AI generates practical usage examples
steps: Step 1: Generate documentation for functions/classes
Step 2: Locate usage examples in generated docs
Step 3: Verify examples are present
Step 4: Verify examples are syntactically correct
Step 5: Verify examples demonstrate actual use cases
Step 6: Verify examples use realistic data
Step 7: Verify examples are properly formatted

description: AI chat can answer questions about specific functions
steps: Step 1: Navigate to chat interface
Step 2: Ask about a specific function (e.g., 'What does calculateTotal do?')
Step 3: Submit question
Step 4: Verify response mentions the function
Step 5: Verify response explains function purpose
Step 6: Verify response includes parameter information
Step 7: Verify response is accurate based on code

description: AI chat can explain architectural patterns
steps: Step 1: Navigate to chat interface
Step 2: Ask about architecture (e.g., 'Explain the authentication flow')
Step 3: Submit question
Step 4: Verify response provides high-level overview
Step 5: Verify response mentions relevant components
Step 6: Verify response explains interactions
Step 7: Verify response is coherent and helpful

description: AI chat can suggest improvements to code
steps: Step 1: Navigate to chat interface
Step 2: Ask for suggestions (e.g., 'How can I improve error handling?')
Step 3: Submit question
Step 4: Verify response provides specific suggestions
Step 5: Verify suggestions reference actual code
Step 6: Verify suggestions are practical
Step 7: Verify suggestions include code examples

description: AI chat maintains conversation context
steps: Step 1: Navigate to chat interface
Step 2: Ask initial question
Step 3: Wait for response
Step 4: Ask follow-up question referencing previous answer
Step 5: Verify follow-up response shows contextual awareness
Step 6: Ask another follow-up
Step 7: Verify multi-turn conversation works
Step 8: Verify context window is managed appropriately

description: Search functionality searches across all documentation types
steps: Step 1: Generate multiple document types (README, API, functions)
Step 2: Navigate to documentation viewer
Step 3: Enter search query matching content in different doc types
Step 4: Verify results from all document types appear
Step 5: Verify results indicate which document they're from
Step 6: Verify clicking result navigates to correct document

description: Search supports fuzzy matching
steps: Step 1: Navigate to search
Step 2: Enter query with typo or partial match
Step 3: Verify relevant results are still returned
Step 4: Test with various misspellings
Step 5: Verify relevance ranking
Step 6: Verify exact matches rank higher than fuzzy matches

description: Search highlights matched terms in results
steps: Step 1: Perform search with specific term
Step 2: View search results
Step 3: Verify matched terms are highlighted
Step 4: Verify highlights use distinct styling
Step 5: Navigate to result
Step 6: Verify term is highlighted in full content

description: Repository list shows sync status for each repository
steps: Step 1: Navigate to dashboard with multiple repositories
Step 2: Verify status indicator for each repository
Step 3: Verify possible statuses: pending, analyzing, completed, error
Step 4: Verify appropriate icon or color for each status
Step 5: Verify last sync timestamp is displayed
Step 6: Verify status updates in real-time if analysis is ongoing

description: Repository list can be filtered by status
steps: Step 1: Navigate to dashboard with multiple repositories
Step 2: Locate filter controls
Step 3: Select 'Completed' filter
Step 4: Verify only completed repositories are shown
Step 5: Select 'Analyzing' filter
Step 6: Verify only analyzing repositories are shown
Step 7: Clear filter and verify all repositories appear

description: Repository list can be sorted by name or last sync
steps: Step 1: Navigate to dashboard
Step 2: Click sort by name
Step 3: Verify repositories are alphabetically sorted
Step 4: Click again to reverse sort
Step 5: Click sort by last sync
Step 6: Verify repositories sorted by sync timestamp
Step 7: Verify most recently synced appears first

description: Repository card shows key metrics (files, lines, last update)
steps: Step 1: Navigate to dashboard
Step 2: View repository cards
Step 3: Verify each card shows file count
Step 4: Verify each card shows line count
Step 5: Verify each card shows last update time
Step 6: Verify metrics are accurate
Step 7: Verify metrics update after re-analysis

description: Repository cards have consistent and attractive design
steps: Step 1: Navigate to dashboard
Step 2: Take screenshot of repository cards
Step 3: Verify cards have consistent styling
Step 4: Verify cards have appropriate spacing
Step 5: Verify cards have hover effects
Step 6: Verify card layout is responsive
Step 7: Verify cards use shadcn/ui components

description: Progress indicator shows analysis stages
steps: Step 1: Trigger repository analysis
Step 2: Observe progress indicator
Step 3: Verify stages are shown (cloning, parsing, generating, etc.)
Step 4: Verify current stage is highlighted
Step 5: Verify percentage or step count is shown
Step 6: Verify progress updates in real-time
Step 7: Verify completion is clearly indicated

description: Error states show helpful error messages with retry option
steps: Step 1: Trigger operation that will fail
Step 2: Wait for error to occur
Step 3: Verify error message is displayed
Step 4: Verify error message is specific and helpful
Step 5: Verify 'Retry' button is provided
Step 6: Click retry button
Step 7: Verify operation is retried

description: Toast notifications appear for important events
steps: Step 1: Trigger various operations (add repo, complete analysis, etc.)
Step 2: Verify toast notification appears for each
Step 3: Verify toasts have appropriate message
Step 4: Verify toasts have appropriate type (success, error, info)
Step 5: Verify toasts auto-dismiss after timeout
Step 6: Verify toasts can be manually dismissed
Step 7: Verify multiple toasts stack appropriately

description: Toast notifications have proper styling and animation
steps: Step 1: Trigger toast notification
Step 2: Observe appearance animation
Step 3: Verify smooth slide-in or fade-in
Step 4: Verify toast is positioned correctly (top-right)
Step 5: Verify toast styling is consistent with design system
Step 6: Observe dismissal animation
Step 7: Take screenshot of toast for verification

description: Navigation menu highlights current page
steps: Step 1: Navigate to dashboard
Step 2: Verify dashboard link is highlighted in navigation
Step 3: Navigate to settings
Step 4: Verify settings link is highlighted
Step 5: Navigate to repository
Step 6: Verify appropriate nav item is highlighted
Step 7: Verify highlighting uses distinct visual style

description: Breadcrumb navigation shows current location
steps: Step 1: Navigate to nested page (e.g., /repos/[id]/chat)
Step 2: Locate breadcrumb navigation
Step 3: Verify breadcrumb shows path hierarchy
Step 4: Click on breadcrumb item
Step 5: Verify navigation to that level
Step 6: Verify breadcrumb updates when navigating
Step 7: Verify home/dashboard link in breadcrumb

description: Back button returns to previous page
steps: Step 1: Navigate through multiple pages
Step 2: Locate back button (browser or in-app)
Step 3: Click back button
Step 4: Verify navigation to previous page
Step 5: Verify page state is preserved if applicable
Step 6: Click back multiple times
Step 7: Verify navigation history is maintained

description: Empty states show helpful messages and actions
steps: Step 1: Login with account that has no repositories
Step 2: Navigate to dashboard
Step 3: Verify empty state message is shown
Step 4: Verify message is encouraging and helpful
Step 5: Verify 'Add Repository' button is prominent
Step 6: Test other empty states (no docs, no chat history)
Step 7: Verify all empty states are well-designed

description: Empty states have engaging illustrations or icons
steps: Step 1: View various empty states
Step 2: Take screenshots
Step 3: Verify each has appropriate icon or illustration
Step 4: Verify visuals are consistent with design system
Step 5: Verify visuals are not overwhelming
Step 6: Verify visuals aid understanding

description: Documentation can be exported as PDF
steps: Step 1: Navigate to documentation viewer
Step 2: Locate 'Export' or 'Download' button
Step 3: Select PDF format
Step 4: Click export
Step 5: Verify PDF is generated
Step 6: Download and open PDF
Step 7: Verify formatting is preserved
Step 8: Verify all content is included

description: Documentation can be exported as Markdown
steps: Step 1: Navigate to documentation viewer
Step 2: Select Markdown export format
Step 3: Click export
Step 4: Verify Markdown file is downloaded
Step 5: Open Markdown file
Step 6: Verify proper Markdown syntax
Step 7: Verify all content is included

description: User can share documentation via public link
steps: Step 1: Navigate to repository settings
Step 2: Locate 'Share' or 'Public Link' option
Step 3: Enable public access
Step 4: Verify public link is generated
Step 5: Copy link and open in incognito/private window
Step 6: Verify documentation is accessible without login
Step 7: Disable public access and verify link no longer works

description: Public documentation links have view-only permissions
steps: Step 1: Create public link for repository
Step 2: Access link without authentication
Step 3: Verify documentation is viewable
Step 4: Verify edit controls are not present
Step 5: Verify settings are not accessible
Step 6: Attempt to access API directly
Step 7: Verify write operations are blocked

description: Analytics track documentation views
steps: Step 1: Navigate to documentation viewer
Step 2: View various documentation pages
Step 3: Navigate to repository settings or analytics
Step 4: Verify view counts are tracked
Step 5: Verify views are associated with pages
Step 6: Verify timestamp of views
Step 7: Verify analytics dashboard displays data

description: Analytics show most viewed documentation pages
steps: Step 1: Generate analytics data with multiple page views
Step 2: Navigate to analytics dashboard
Step 3: Verify 'Most Viewed' section exists
Step 4: Verify pages are ranked by view count
Step 5: Verify view counts are displayed
Step 6: Verify ability to click through to pages
Step 7: Verify data updates over time

description: Form validation provides immediate feedback
steps: Step 1: Navigate to form (e.g., add repository)
Step 2: Enter invalid data in field
Step 3: Tab out of field or trigger validation
Step 4: Verify validation error appears immediately
Step 5: Verify error message is specific and helpful
Step 6: Correct the error
Step 7: Verify error message disappears
Step 8: Verify field shows valid state

description: Form error states have clear visual indicators
steps: Step 1: Trigger form validation errors
Step 2: Take screenshot of error states
Step 3: Verify error fields have red border or indicator
Step 4: Verify error messages are visible and nearby
Step 5: Verify error icon is present
Step 6: Verify overall form indicates there are errors
Step 7: Verify consistent error styling across forms

description: Required fields are clearly marked
steps: Step 1: Navigate to any form
Step 2: Verify required fields have asterisk or indicator
Step 3: Verify legend/note explains required field marker
Step 4: Attempt to submit form with required fields empty
Step 5: Verify validation prevents submission
Step 6: Verify clear feedback about missing required fields

description: Keyboard shortcuts enhance productivity
steps: Step 1: Navigate to application
Step 2: Press '/' or 'Ctrl+K' to focus search
Step 3: Verify search is focused
Step 4: Try other shortcuts (e.g., '?' for help)
Step 5: Verify shortcuts modal or hint system
Step 6: Test navigation shortcuts if applicable
Step 7: Verify shortcuts work across pages

description: Command palette provides quick access to features
steps: Step 1: Press Ctrl+K or Cmd+K
Step 2: Verify command palette opens
Step 3: Type to search available commands
Step 4: Verify commands are filtered as you type
Step 5: Select a command
Step 6: Verify command executes or navigates appropriately
Step 7: Test various command types (navigation, actions)

description: Command palette has intuitive design
steps: Step 1: Open command palette
Step 2: Take screenshot
Step 3: Verify modal/overlay styling is appropriate
Step 4: Verify commands are easy to read
Step 5: Verify keyboard hints are shown (e.g., 'Enter to select')
Step 6: Verify icons or categories for commands
Step 7: Verify search input is clearly focused

description: User can customize documentation template preferences
steps: Step 1: Navigate to user settings
Step 2: Locate documentation preferences section
Step 3: Modify template options (e.g., sections to include)
Step 4: Save preferences
Step 5: Generate new documentation
Step 6: Verify documentation follows custom template
Step 7: Verify preferences persist across sessions

description: User can set documentation tone preference (formal/casual)
steps: Step 1: Navigate to settings
Step 2: Locate tone preference setting
Step 3: Select 'Formal' tone
Step 4: Generate documentation
Step 5: Verify documentation uses formal language
Step 6: Change to 'Casual' tone
Step 7: Regenerate documentation
Step 8: Verify documentation uses casual language

description: User can specify documentation audience level
steps: Step 1: Navigate to documentation preferences
Step 2: Select audience level (beginner/intermediate/expert)
Step 3: Generate documentation
Step 4: Verify documentation complexity matches audience
Step 5: Verify appropriate level of detail
Step 6: Verify explanations match audience knowledge
Step 7: Test with different audience levels

description: OAuth token refresh works seamlessly
steps: Step 1: Login with GitHub OAuth
Step 2: Wait for access token to near expiration
Step 3: Perform action requiring GitHub API
Step 4: Verify token is refreshed automatically
Step 5: Verify action completes successfully
Step 6: Verify user is not logged out
Step 7: Verify refresh is logged

description: Expired sessions redirect to login gracefully
steps: Step 1: Login to application
Step 2: Wait for session to expire or manually expire
Step 3: Attempt to perform authenticated action
Step 4: Verify user is redirected to login
Step 5: Verify helpful message about session expiration
Step 6: Login again
Step 7: Verify redirect back to original intended action if applicable

description: API endpoints return proper HTTP status codes
steps: Step 1: Call successful API endpoint
Step 2: Verify 200 OK status
Step 3: Call endpoint with invalid data
Step 4: Verify 400 Bad Request status
Step 5: Call protected endpoint without auth
Step 6: Verify 401 Unauthorized status
Step 7: Call endpoint for non-existent resource
Step 8: Verify 404 Not Found status
Step 9: Test other scenarios for proper status codes

description: API responses include proper CORS headers
steps: Step 1: Make API request from different origin
Step 2: Verify Access-Control-Allow-Origin header
Step 3: Make preflight OPTIONS request
Step 4: Verify appropriate CORS headers in response
Step 5: Verify credentials handling if applicable
Step 6: Test with various origins
Step 7: Verify CORS errors are properly handled

description: API implements request validation middleware
steps: Step 1: Send API request with invalid JSON
Step 2: Verify 400 error with helpful message
Step 3: Send request missing required fields
Step 4: Verify validation error response
Step 5: Send request with wrong data types
Step 6: Verify type validation works
Step 7: Verify validation happens before business logic

description: API logging captures requests and responses
steps: Step 1: Make various API requests
Step 2: Check application logs
Step 3: Verify requests are logged with method and path
Step 4: Verify response status is logged
Step 5: Verify timing information is logged
Step 6: Verify errors are logged with details
Step 7: Verify sensitive data is redacted in logs

description: Security headers are set on all responses
steps: Step 1: Make request to application
Step 2: Inspect response headers
Step 3: Verify X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
Step 4: Verify X-Frame-Options: DENY or SAMEORIGIN
Step 5: Verify Content-Security-Policy header
Step 6: Verify Strict-Transport-Security header
Step 7: Verify X-XSS-Protection header

description: Secrets and API keys are stored securely
steps: Step 1: Inspect codebase
Step 2: Verify no hardcoded secrets in source
Step 3: Verify environment variables are used
Step 4: Verify secrets are not logged
Step 5: Verify secrets are not exposed in client-side code
Step 6: Verify secure storage mechanism for sensitive data
Step 7: Verify database credentials are protected

description: SQL injection prevention is implemented
steps: Step 1: Attempt SQL injection via input fields
Step 2: Verify parameterized queries are used
Step 3: Verify ORM prevents SQL injection
Step 4: Try various injection patterns
Step 5: Verify no raw SQL with string concatenation
Step 6: Verify all database queries are safe
Step 7: Verify error messages don't reveal DB structure

description: XSS protection prevents script injection
steps: Step 1: Attempt to inject script tags via inputs
Step 2: Verify input is sanitized
Step 3: Verify output is properly escaped
Step 4: Test with various XSS payloads
Step 5: Verify CSP headers help prevent XSS
Step 6: Verify framework auto-escaping is enabled
Step 7: Test in documentation rendering (user-generated content)

description: CSRF protection is implemented for state-changing operations
steps: Step 1: Inspect state-changing endpoints (POST, PUT, DELETE)
Step 2: Verify CSRF tokens are required
Step 3: Attempt request without CSRF token
Step 4: Verify request is rejected
Step 5: Verify CSRF tokens are validated
Step 6: Verify tokens are properly generated
Step 7: Verify SameSite cookie attribute is set

description: File upload validation prevents malicious files
steps: Step 1: Attempt to upload file (if feature exists)
Step 2: Verify file type validation
Step 3: Verify file size limits
Step 4: Attempt to upload executable or script
Step 5: Verify malicious files are rejected
Step 6: Verify content type verification
Step 7: Verify uploaded files are scanned/validated

description: Dependencies are up-to-date and secure
steps: Step 1: Run npm audit or equivalent
Step 2: Verify no high/critical vulnerabilities
Step 3: Check for outdated packages
Step 4: Verify security patches are applied
Step 5: Verify dependency lock file is committed
Step 6: Check for known vulnerable packages
Step 7: Verify automated dependency updates are configured

description: Environment variables are properly configured for production
steps: Step 1: Check production environment configuration
Step 2: Verify all required env vars are set
Step 3: Verify debug mode is disabled
Step 4: Verify appropriate logging level
Step 5: Verify production API endpoints are used
Step 6: Verify secure flags are enabled
Step 7: Verify no development-only settings in production

description: Application has health check endpoint
steps: Step 1: Make request to /health or /api/health
Step 2: Verify endpoint returns 200 OK when healthy
Step 3: Verify response includes status information
Step 4: Verify database connectivity is checked
Step 5: Verify external service connectivity is checked
Step 6: Simulate unhealthy state
Step 7: Verify appropriate error status and details

description: Application logs are structured and searchable
steps: Step 1: Trigger various application events
Step 2: Check log output
Step 3: Verify logs use JSON or structured format
Step 4: Verify logs include timestamp
Step 5: Verify logs include severity level
Step 6: Verify logs include correlation IDs
Step 7: Verify logs are searchable by key fields

description: Error tracking captures and reports errors
steps: Step 1: Integrate error tracking service (Sentry, etc.)
Step 2: Trigger an error in the application
Step 3: Verify error is captured
Step 4: Verify stack trace is included
Step 5: Verify user context is attached
Step 6: Verify breadcrumbs are captured
Step 7: Verify errors are grouped appropriately

description: Performance monitoring tracks key metrics
steps: Step 1: Implement performance monitoring
Step 2: Perform various operations
Step 3: Verify response times are tracked
Step 4: Verify throughput metrics are collected
Step 5: Verify error rates are monitored
Step 6: Verify database query times are tracked
Step 7: Verify metrics are accessible for analysis

description: Frontend build process optimizes for production
steps: Step 1: Run production build
Step 2: Verify minification is applied
Step 3: Verify code splitting is implemented
Step 4: Verify tree shaking removes unused code
Step 5: Verify bundle size is reasonable
Step 6: Verify source maps are generated but not exposed
Step 7: Verify assets are hashed for cache busting

description: Images are optimized and lazy loaded
steps: Step 1: Navigate to pages with images
Step 2: Verify images are compressed/optimized
Step 3: Verify responsive images are used (srcset)
Step 4: Verify images below fold are lazy loaded
Step 5: Verify proper image formats (WebP with fallback)
Step 6: Verify image dimensions are specified
Step 7: Check Lighthouse score for image optimization

description: CSS is optimized and doesn't block rendering
steps: Step 1: Analyze page load
Step 2: Verify critical CSS is inlined
Step 3: Verify non-critical CSS is async loaded
Step 4: Verify CSS is minified
Step 5: Verify unused CSS is purged
Step 6: Check for render-blocking CSS
Step 7: Verify CSS performance in Lighthouse

description: JavaScript is optimized and chunked appropriately
steps: Step 1: Analyze JavaScript bundles
Step 2: Verify code splitting by route
Step 3: Verify vendor code is separate chunk
Step 4: Verify large dependencies are code-split
Step 5: Verify no duplicate code across chunks
Step 6: Verify bundle sizes are reasonable
Step 7: Check bundle analysis report

description: Caching headers are set appropriately
steps: Step 1: Make requests to various resources
Step 2: Verify static assets have long cache times
Step 3: Verify HTML has short cache or no-cache
Step 4: Verify API responses have appropriate cache headers
Step 5: Verify ETags are used
Step 6: Test cache behavior
Step 7: Verify cache invalidation works

description: CDN is used for static asset delivery
steps: Step 1: Inspect asset URLs
Step 2: Verify static assets served from CDN
Step 3: Verify CDN headers are present
Step 4: Test asset loading speed
Step 5: Verify geo-distributed delivery
Step 6: Verify SSL on CDN
Step 7: Verify CDN caching is configured

description: Lighthouse performance score is above 90
steps: Step 1: Run Lighthouse audit on landing page
Step 2: Verify performance score is above 90
Step 3: Run audit on dashboard
Step 4: Verify performance score is above 90
Step 5: Run audit on documentation viewer
Step 6: Verify performance score is above 90
Step 7: Address any performance issues flagged

description: Lighthouse accessibility score is 100
steps: Step 1: Run Lighthouse accessibility audit
Step 2: Verify score is 100
Step 3: Fix any flagged issues
Step 4: Verify color contrast ratios
Step 5: Verify semantic HTML
Step 6: Verify ARIA labels where needed
Step 7: Re-run audit to confirm

description: Lighthouse SEO score is 100
steps: Step 1: Run Lighthouse SEO audit
Step 2: Verify score is 100
Step 3: Verify meta tags are present
Step 4: Verify Open Graph tags
Step 5: Verify robots.txt exists
Step 6: Verify sitemap.xml exists
Step 7: Verify canonical URLs

description: Lighthouse best practices score is 100
steps: Step 1: Run Lighthouse best practices audit
Step 2: Verify score is 100
Step 3: Verify HTTPS is used everywhere
Step 4: Verify no console errors
Step 5: Verify proper image aspect ratios
Step 6: Verify no vulnerable libraries
Step 7: Address any flagged issues

description: Screen readers can navigate the application
steps: Step 1: Enable screen reader (NVDA, JAWS, VoiceOver)
Step 2: Navigate landing page with screen reader
Step 3: Verify all content is announced
Step 4: Navigate through dashboard
Step 5: Verify logical reading order
Step 6: Test form interactions
Step 7: Verify all interactive elements are accessible

description: Skip to main content link is present
steps: Step 1: Navigate to any page
Step 2: Press Tab key immediately
Step 3: Verify 'Skip to main content' link appears
Step 4: Activate the link
Step 5: Verify focus moves to main content
Step 6: Verify link is visually hidden until focused
Step 7: Test on multiple pages

description: All images have appropriate alt text
steps: Step 1: Inspect all images in application
Step 2: Verify alt attributes are present
Step 3: Verify alt text is descriptive
Step 4: Verify decorative images have empty alt
Step 5: Verify complex images have detailed descriptions
Step 6: Use automated checker to find missing alt
Step 7: Fix any issues found

description: Form labels are properly associated with inputs
steps: Step 1: Inspect all forms
Step 2: Verify every input has a label
Step 3: Verify labels use 'for' attribute or wrap input
Step 4: Click labels to verify focus moves to input
Step 5: Verify placeholder is not used as only label
Step 6: Verify field purposes are clear
Step 7: Test with screen reader

description: ARIA landmarks identify page regions
steps: Step 1: Inspect page HTML
Step 2: Verify header uses <header> or role='banner'
Step 3: Verify main content uses <main> or role='main'
Step 4: Verify navigation uses <nav> or role='navigation'
Step 5: Verify footer uses <footer> or role='contentinfo'
Step 6: Test navigation with screen reader
Step 7: Verify logical landmark structure

description: Color is not the only means of conveying information
steps: Step 1: Identify elements that use color to convey meaning
Step 2: Verify additional indicators (icons, text, patterns)
Step 3: Test with grayscale filter
Step 4: Verify success/error states have icons plus color
Step 5: Verify links are distinguishable without color
Step 6: Test with color blindness simulator
Step 7: Fix any color-only dependencies

description: Text can be resized to 200% without loss of functionality
steps: Step 1: Navigate to application
Step 2: Increase browser zoom to 200%
Step 3: Verify text is readable
Step 4: Verify no content is cut off
Step 5: Verify all functionality still works
Step 6: Verify no horizontal scrolling required
Step 7: Test on multiple pages

description: Animations respect prefers-reduced-motion
steps: Step 1: Enable reduced motion in OS settings
Step 2: Navigate through application
Step 3: Verify animations are reduced or removed
Step 4: Verify transitions are instant or subtle
Step 5: Verify functionality not dependent on animation
Step 6: Disable reduced motion
Step 7: Verify animations return to normal

description: Modal dialogs trap focus and can be closed with Escape
steps: Step 1: Open a modal dialog
Step 2: Try to Tab outside modal
Step 3: Verify focus stays within modal
Step 4: Press Escape key
Step 5: Verify modal closes
Step 6: Verify focus returns to trigger element
Step 7: Test with screen reader

description: All interactive elements are keyboard accessible
steps: Step 1: Navigate application using only keyboard
Step 2: Verify all buttons are reachable via Tab
Step 3: Verify all links are reachable
Step 4: Verify custom controls are keyboard accessible
Step 5: Verify dropdowns work with arrow keys
Step 6: Verify complex widgets follow ARIA patterns
Step 7: Verify no keyboard traps

description: Page titles are descriptive and unique
steps: Step 1: Navigate to landing page
Step 2: Verify page title in browser tab is descriptive
Step 3: Navigate to dashboard
Step 4: Verify title is different and descriptive
Step 5: Navigate to other pages
Step 6: Verify each page has unique, descriptive title
Step 7: Verify title format is consistent

description: Language of page is declared
steps: Step 1: View page source
Step 2: Verify <html> tag has lang attribute
Step 3: Verify lang='en' or appropriate language code
Step 4: If multiple languages, verify lang on elements
Step 5: Verify language changes are marked up
Step 6: Test with screen reader
Step 7: Verify pronunciation is correct

description: Meta description is present on public pages
steps: Step 1: View source of landing page
Step 2: Verify meta description tag exists
Step 3: Verify description is compelling and accurate
Step 4: Verify length is appropriate (150-160 chars)
Step 5: Check other public pages
Step 6: Verify each page has unique description
Step 7: Verify no duplicate meta descriptions

description: Open Graph tags are set for social sharing
steps: Step 1: View source of landing page
Step 2: Verify og:title is present
Step 3: Verify og:description is present
Step 4: Verify og:image is present
Step 5: Verify og:url is present
Step 6: Test sharing on social media
Step 7: Verify preview looks correct

description: Robots.txt allows appropriate crawling
steps: Step 1: Navigate to /robots.txt
Step 2: Verify file exists
Step 3: Verify public pages are not disallowed
Step 4: Verify private/admin pages are disallowed
Step 5: Verify sitemap is referenced
Step 6: Verify crawl delay if needed
Step 7: Test with robots.txt tester

description: Sitemap.xml is generated and accessible
steps: Step 1: Navigate to /sitemap.xml
Step 2: Verify file exists and is valid XML
Step 3: Verify public pages are included
Step 4: Verify URLs are absolute
Step 5: Verify lastmod dates are present
Step 6: Verify priority is set appropriately
Step 7: Submit sitemap to search engines

description: Structured data (JSON-LD) is present for rich snippets
steps: Step 1: View source of relevant pages
Step 2: Verify JSON-LD script tag is present
Step 3: Verify schema.org types are used
Step 4: Verify data is accurate
Step 5: Test with Google Rich Results Test
Step 6: Verify no errors in structured data
Step 7: Verify appropriate schemas for page types

description: Canonical URLs prevent duplicate content issues
steps: Step 1: View source of pages
Step 2: Verify <link rel='canonical'> is present
Step 3: Verify canonical URL is correct
Step 4: Check pages accessible via multiple URLs
Step 5: Verify canonical points to preferred version
Step 6: Test with trailing slashes, query params
Step 7: Verify no conflicting canonical tags

description: 404 page is helpful and branded
steps: Step 1: Navigate to non-existent URL
Step 2: Verify 404 status code is returned
Step 3: Verify custom 404 page is shown
Step 4: Verify page is branded (logo, styling)
Step 5: Verify helpful message and suggestions
Step 6: Verify navigation back to home
Step 7: Verify search or links to popular pages

description: 500 error page is handled gracefully
steps: Step 1: Trigger server error
Step 2: Verify 500 status code
Step 3: Verify custom error page is shown
Step 4: Verify user-friendly error message
Step 5: Verify no stack traces or sensitive info
Step 6: Verify option to retry or go home
Step 7: Verify error is logged on backend

description: Documentation includes code examples with syntax highlighting
steps: Step 1: View generated documentation
Step 2: Locate code examples
Step 3: Verify syntax highlighting is applied
Step 4: Verify highlighting is accurate for language
Step 5: Verify code is readable
Step 6: Verify copy button is present
Step 7: Test in both light and dark mode

description: Documentation viewer has print-friendly styles
steps: Step 1: Navigate to documentation
Step 2: Open print preview
Step 3: Verify layout is optimized for print
Step 4: Verify unnecessary UI elements are hidden
Step 5: Verify page breaks are appropriate
Step 6: Verify code blocks are readable
Step 7: Verify links show URLs in print

description: Code analysis handles edge cases gracefully
steps: Step 1: Analyze repository with unusual code patterns
Step 2: Test with very long files
Step 3: Test with binary files
Step 4: Test with empty files
Step 5: Test with files without extensions
Step 6: Test with malformed syntax
Step 7: Verify analysis doesn't crash
Step 8: Verify errors are logged and handled

description: Repository re-sync is idempotent
steps: Step 1: Sync repository for first time
Step 2: Note results and documentation
Step 3: Trigger sync again without changes
Step 4: Verify results are identical
Step 5: Verify no duplicate documents
Step 6: Verify timestamps are updated
Step 7: Verify multiple syncs don't cause issues

description: Large documentation is paginated or virtualized
steps: Step 1: Generate documentation for large repository
Step 2: Navigate to documentation viewer
Step 3: Verify content is paginated or lazy-loaded
Step 4: Verify scroll performance is smooth
Step 5: Verify memory usage is reasonable
Step 6: Test navigation between large sections
Step 7: Verify no performance degradation

description: Chat history is persisted and retrievable
steps: Step 1: Have conversation in chat interface
Step 2: Navigate away from chat
Step 3: Return to chat interface
Step 4: Verify conversation history is shown
Step 5: Log out and log back in
Step 6: Return to chat
Step 7: Verify history is still preserved

description: Chat can handle very long conversations
steps: Step 1: Start chat conversation
Step 2: Send many messages (50+)
Step 3: Verify all messages are displayed
Step 4: Verify scrolling works smoothly
Step 5: Verify old messages are loaded as needed
Step 6: Verify context window is managed (last N messages)
Step 7: Verify performance doesn't degrade

description: Chat messages can include code blocks
steps: Step 1: Send chat message that includes code
Step 2: Verify AI response includes code blocks
Step 3: Verify code blocks have syntax highlighting
Step 4: Verify code blocks have copy button
Step 5: Verify code formatting is preserved
Step 6: Verify inline code is styled appropriately
Step 7: Test with various programming languages

description: User can clear chat history
steps: Step 1: Have conversation in chat
Step 2: Locate 'Clear History' button
Step 3: Click to clear
Step 4: Verify confirmation dialog
Step 5: Confirm clearing
Step 6: Verify chat history is deleted
Step 7: Verify new conversation can be started

description: Chat interface has modern, messaging-app-like design
steps: Step 1: Navigate to chat interface
Step 2: Take screenshot
Step 3: Verify messages are in bubbles
Step 4: Verify user and AI messages are visually distinct
Step 5: Verify timestamps are shown
Step 6: Verify scrolling is smooth
Step 7: Verify input area is fixed at bottom

description: Documentation can be regenerated without losing custom settings
steps: Step 1: Set custom documentation preferences
Step 2: Generate documentation
Step 3: Trigger regeneration
Step 4: Verify custom settings are preserved
Step 5: Verify new documentation follows settings
Step 6: Verify old docs are overwritten appropriately
Step 7: Verify no data loss

description: Multiple repositories can be analyzed concurrently
steps: Step 1: Add multiple repositories
Step 2: Trigger analysis for all simultaneously
Step 3: Verify all analyses start
Step 4: Verify progress for each is tracked independently
Step 5: Verify no interference between analyses
Step 6: Verify all complete successfully
Step 7: Verify system resources are managed well

description: Claude API usage is tracked and monitored
steps: Step 1: Perform operations that use Claude API
Step 2: Check API usage tracking
Step 3: Verify requests are counted
Step 4: Verify tokens are counted
Step 5: Verify costs are calculated if applicable
Step 6: Verify usage limits are enforced
Step 7: Verify monitoring alerts for high usage

description: Database connection pool is configured properly
steps: Step 1: Check database connection configuration
Step 2: Verify pool size is appropriate
Step 3: Verify connection timeout is set
Step 4: Verify idle timeout is set
Step 5: Verify max connections is reasonable
Step 6: Test under load
Step 7: Verify no connection leaks

description: Database migrations are version controlled
steps: Step 1: Check for database migration files
Step 2: Verify migrations are in source control
Step 3: Verify migrations are numbered/timestamped
Step 4: Verify migrations can be rolled back
Step 5: Run migrations in test environment
Step 6: Verify schema matches expected state
Step 7: Verify migration history is tracked

description: Database indexes optimize query performance
steps: Step 1: Review database schema
Step 2: Verify indexes on foreign keys
Step 3: Verify indexes on frequently queried columns
Step 4: Run query performance tests
Step 5: Verify query plans use indexes
Step 6: Check for missing indexes
Step 7: Verify no over-indexing

description: Vector database (Pinecone) namespace strategy is implemented
steps: Step 1: Review Pinecone usage
Step 2: Verify namespaces separate different repositories
Step 3: Verify namespace naming is consistent
Step 4: Verify queries are scoped to correct namespace
Step 5: Verify namespace deletion on repo removal
Step 6: Test cross-repository isolation
Step 7: Verify no data leakage between namespaces

description: Backup and restore procedures are documented and tested
steps: Step 1: Review backup configuration
Step 2: Verify automated backups are scheduled
Step 3: Verify backup frequency is appropriate
Step 4: Verify backups include all critical data
Step 5: Test restore procedure
Step 6: Verify data integrity after restore
Step 7: Document backup/restore process

description: Deployment process is automated and documented
steps: Step 1: Review deployment configuration
Step 2: Verify CI/CD pipeline exists
Step 3: Verify automated tests run before deploy
Step 4: Verify deploy to staging environment works
Step 5: Verify deploy to production works
Step 6: Verify rollback procedure exists
Step 7: Document deployment process

description: Environment parity between staging and production
steps: Step 1: Compare staging and production configs
Step 2: Verify same versions of dependencies
Step 3: Verify same infrastructure setup
Step 4: Verify similar data for testing
Step 5: Test feature in staging
Step 6: Deploy to production
Step 7: Verify consistent behavior

description: Zero-downtime deployment is possible
steps: Step 1: Prepare deployment
Step 2: Deploy new version
Step 3: Verify old version continues serving during deploy
Step 4: Verify health checks pass for new version
Step 5: Verify traffic is shifted to new version
Step 6: Verify no 503 errors during deployment
Step 7: Verify rollback works if needed

description: README.md in repository root documents setup and usage
steps: Step 1: Check for README.md in project root
Step 2: Verify README includes project description
Step 3: Verify setup instructions are clear
Step 4: Verify prerequisites are listed
Step 5: Verify usage examples are provided
Step 6: Verify deployment instructions are included
Step 7: Verify README is up-to-date

description: Code follows consistent style guide
steps: Step 1: Review codebase
Step 2: Verify linter is configured (ESLint, Prettier)
Step 3: Verify linter rules are consistent
Step 4: Run linter on codebase
Step 5: Verify no linting errors
Step 6: Verify pre-commit hooks enforce linting
Step 7: Verify style guide is documented

description: Git commit history is clean and meaningful
steps: Step 1: Review git commit log
Step 2: Verify commit messages are descriptive
Step 3: Verify commits are atomic (single purpose)
Step 4: Verify no sensitive data in history
Step 5: Verify no huge commits with unrelated changes
Step 6: Verify consistent commit message format
Step 7: Verify branch strategy is followed
